info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:15PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Storey and northern Lyon Counties through 300 PM PDT... At 215 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Dayton, or 12 miles east of Virginia City, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fernley, Dayton, Fort Churchill Station, Silver Springs, Stagecoach, Junction U.S 50 And Six Mile Canyon-Ft Churchill Rd, Rawe Peak and Silver Springs Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
